title: OnOptions
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Former Sears boss says CEOs won’t challenge Trump’s tariffs out of ‘cowardice’—but the holidays are fast approaching, and ‘the party is over’
items.description: He expects many shelves at retailers will be empty this holiday season.

items.title: An AWS Outage Took Down Snapchat, Fortnite, and ChatGPT, and Showed How Fragile Everything Really Is
items.description: No one thinks about how much we depend on big tech platforms until they fail.

items.title: Why a Quarter of Employees Don’t Take Any Company-Provided PTO
items.description: Most employees cited high workloads, feelings of guilt, and manager discouragement as the culprits.

items.title: Visa wants to chart a safe course for e-commerce’s AI revolution
items.description: E-commerce continues to eat up ever-increasing share of the U.S. retail market: Americans bought more than $3.3 billion of items online every day in t...

items.title: Walmart has spent more than $110 million buying malls this year in a move to become a property owner, not just a tenant
items.description: Walmart already owns most of its locations. But recent deals are part of an emerging pattern.

items.title: What is happening to the economy right now, according the SF Fed President
items.description: The Federal Reserve’s influence on the economy is immense, and often misunderstood. President of the San Francisco Fed Mary Daly gives an exclusive, f...

items.title: Why You Should Think Like a Startup With Nothing to Lose
items.description: Most established companies struggle to innovate, not because they lack smart people, but because their own success traps them.

items.title: Air traffic controllers are becoming Uber drivers and restaurant servers on top of six-day airport shifts to make ends meet during government shutdown
items.description: Deemed essential workers, controllers are required to work during the shutdown, but will receive a $0 paycheck starting next week.

items.title: Want to Keep Your Workers Happy? Don’t Fake Promote Them With New Job Titles
items.description: There seems to be an epidemic of giving workers extra duties and more impressive job titles but without extra pay.

items.title: The best way to earn billionaire status is to follow in Warren Buffett’s footsteps: 15% of billionaires derive net worth from the finance industry
items.description: U.S. billionaires are collectively worth about $7.6 trillion

items.title: Adobe just built an industrial-grade AI weapon for the world’s biggest brands
items.description: Hannah Alsark says that Adobe’s top clients—the owners of some of the most protected, most valuable brands and IP in the world—had a stark message for...

items.title: 42 million Americans could lose food stamps as shutdown drags on
items.description: With no end in sight for the political standoff that shuttered the federal government, funding for some key programs is drying up. More than 40 millio...

items.title: Ex-Neuralink Exec’s New Startup Is Tackling Blindness—and Winning
items.description: Science Corp. uses solar panel-like technology implanted in a patient’s eye. Early results for people with macular degeneration are impressive.

items.title: Wall Street hovers near records ahead of earnings, inflation data this week
items.description: Stocks are climbing on Wall Street Monday and pulling near their records following last week’s roller-coaster ride . The S&P 500 rose 1% and got back ...

items.title: Top analyst still thinks we’re on the cusp of a new boom for the economy, but investors aren’t with him: ‘Markets remain choppy’
items.description: Morgan Stanley’s Mike Wilson says he needs to see more before giving the “all-clear” on chances of a further near-term correction.
